name: Trimmomatic
author: UNKNOWN
description: It works with FASTQ (using phred + 33 or phred + 64 quality scores, depending on the Illumina pipeline used), either uncompressed or gzipp'ed FASTQ. Use of gzip format is determined based on the .gz extension. For single-ended data, one input and one output file are specified, plus the processing steps. For paired-end data, two input files are specified, and 4 output files, 2 for the paired output where both reads survived the processing, and 2 for corresponding unpaired output where a read survived, but the partner read did not.

commands.name: trimmomatic
commands.description: It works with FASTQ (using phred + 33 or phred + 64 quality scores, depending on the Illumina pipeline used), either uncompressed or gzipp'ed FASTQ. Use of gzip format is determined based on the .gz extension. For single-ended data, one input and one output file are specified, plus the processing steps. For paired-end data, two input files are specified, and 4 output files, 2 for the paired output where both reads survived the processing, and 2 for corresponding unpaired output where a read survived, but the partner read did not.

arguments.name: mode
arguments.description: For single-ended data, one input and one output file are specified, plus the processing steps. For paired-end data, two input files are specified, and 4 output files, 2 for the 'paired' output where both reads survived the processing, and 2 for corresponding 'unpaired' output where a read survived, but the partner read did not.

arguments.name: threads
arguments.description: indicates the number of threads to use, which improves performance on multi-core computers. If not specified, it will be chosen automatically

arguments.name: quality
arguments.description: phred + 33 or phred + 64 quality scores

arguments.name: trimlog
arguments.description:
specifies the path to the log file. Log file contains info as : 
-the read name
-the surviving sequence length
-the location of the first surviving base, aka. the amount trimmed from the start
-the location of the last surviving base in the original read-
the amount trimmed from the end

arguments.name: inputFile
arguments.description: Specifies the path to the fastq input file.

arguments.name: paired input 1
arguments.description: Specifies the path to the input file 1 of paired mode.

arguments.name: paired input 2
arguments.description: Specifies the path to the input file 2 of paired mode.

arguments.name: outputFile
arguments.description: Specifies the name of output file.

arguments.name: paired output 1
arguments.description: Specifies the name of paired output file 1.

arguments.name: unpaired output 1
arguments.description: Specifies the name of unpaired output file 1.

arguments.name: paired output 2
arguments.description: Specifies the name of paired output file 2.

arguments.name: unpaired output 2
arguments.description: Specifies the name of unpaired output file 2.

arguments.name: fastaWithAdaptersEtc
arguments.description: Specifies the path to a fasta file containing all the adapters, PCR sequences etc. The naming of the various sequences within this file determines how they are used.

arguments.name: seed mismatches
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum mismatch count which will still allow a full match to be performed.

arguments.name: palindrome clip threshold
arguments.description: Specifies how accurate the match between the two 'adapter ligated' reads must be for PE palindrome read alignment.

arguments.name: simple clip threshold
arguments.description: Specifies how accurate the match between any adapter etc. sequence must be against a read.

arguments.name: windowSize
arguments.description: Specifies the number of bases to average across.

arguments.name: requiredQuality
arguments.description: Specifies the average quality required.

arguments.name: leading quality
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum quality required to keep a base.

arguments.name: trailing quality
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum quality required to keep a base.

arguments.name: crop length
arguments.description: The number of bases to keep, from the start of the read.

arguments.name: headcrop length
arguments.description: The number of bases to remove from the start of the read.

arguments.name: minlen length
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum length of reads to be kept.
